trans-unit.source: Handle file activation
trans-unit.target: Handle file activation

trans-unit.source: An app can register to become the default handler for a certain file type.
trans-unit.target: An app can register to become the default handler for a certain file type.

trans-unit.source: Handle file activation
trans-unit.target: Handle file activation

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.FileActivatedEventArgs
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.Activation.FileActivatedEventArgs

trans-unit.source: Windows.UI.Xaml.Application.OnFileActivated
trans-unit.target: Windows.UI.Xaml.Application.OnFileActivated

trans-unit.source: An app can register to become the default handler for a certain file type.
trans-unit.target: An app can register to become the default handler for a certain file type.

trans-unit.source: Both Classic Windows Platform (CWP) apps and Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can register to be a default file handler.
trans-unit.target: Both Classic Windows Platform (CWP) apps and Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps can register to be a default file handler.

trans-unit.source: If the user chooses your app as the default handler for a certain file type, your app will be activated when that type of file is launched.
trans-unit.target: If the user chooses your app as the default handler for a certain file type, your app will be activated when that type of file is launched.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you only register for a file type if you expect to handle all file launches for that type of file.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you only register for a file type if you expect to handle all file launches for that type of file.

trans-unit.source: If your app only needs to use the file type internally, then you don't need to register to be the default handler.
trans-unit.target: If your app only needs to use the file type internally, then you don't need to register to be the default handler.

trans-unit.source: If you do choose to register for a file type, you must provide the end user with the functionality that is expected when your app is activated for that file type.
trans-unit.target: If you do choose to register for a file type, you must provide the end user with the functionality that is expected when your app is activated for that file type.

trans-unit.source: For example, a picture viewer app may register to display a .jpg file.
trans-unit.target: For example, a picture viewer app may register to display a .jpg file.

trans-unit.source: For more info on file associations, see [Guidelines for file types and URIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700321).
trans-unit.target: For more info on file associations, see [Guidelines for file types and URIs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700321).

trans-unit.source: These steps show how to register for a custom file type, .alsdk, and how to activate your app when the user launches an .alsdk file.
trans-unit.target: These steps show how to register for a custom file type, .alsdk, and how to activate your app when the user launches an .alsdk file.

trans-unit.source: **Note** In UWP apps, certain URIs and file extensions are reserved for use by built-in apps and the operating system.
trans-unit.target: **Note** In UWP apps, certain URIs and file extensions are reserved for use by built-in apps and the operating system.

trans-unit.source: Attempts to register your app with a reserved URI or file extension will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: Attempts to register your app with a reserved URI or file extension will be ignored.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Reserved file and URI scheme names](reserved-uri-scheme-names.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Reserved file and URI scheme names](reserved-uri-scheme-names.md).

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Specify the extension point in the package manifest
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Specify the extension point in the package manifest

trans-unit.source: The app receives activation events only for the file extensions listed in the package manifest.
trans-unit.target: The app receives activation events only for the file extensions listed in the package manifest.

trans-unit.source: Here's how you indicate that your app handles the files with the `.alsdk` extension.
trans-unit.target: Here's how you indicate that your app handles the files with the `.alsdk` extension.

trans-unit.source: In the **Solution Explorer**, double-click package.appxmanifest to open the manifest designer.
trans-unit.target: In the **Solution Explorer**, double-click package.appxmanifest to open the manifest designer.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Declarations** tab and in the **Available Declarations** drop-down, select **File Type Associations** and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Declarations** tab and in the **Available Declarations** drop-down, select **File Type Associations** and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: See [Programmatic Identifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144152) for more details of identifiers used by file associations.
trans-unit.target: See [Programmatic Identifiers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144152) for more details of identifiers used by file associations.

trans-unit.source: Here is a brief description of each of the fields that you may fill in the manifest designer:
trans-unit.target: Here is a brief description of each of the fields that you may fill in the manifest designer:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Display Name
trans-unit.target: Display Name

trans-unit.source: Specify the display name for a group of file types.
trans-unit.target: Specify the display name for a group of file types.

trans-unit.source: The display name is used to identify the file type in the [Set Default Programs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144154) on the **Control Panel**.
trans-unit.target: The display name is used to identify the file type in the [Set Default Programs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144154) on the **Control Panel**.

trans-unit.source: Logo
trans-unit.target: Logo

trans-unit.source: Specify the logo that is used to identify the file type on the desktop and in the [Set Default Programs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144154) on the **Control Panel**.
trans-unit.target: Specify the logo that is used to identify the file type on the desktop and in the [Set Default Programs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144154) on the **Control Panel**.

trans-unit.source: If no Logo is specified, the application’s small logo is used.
trans-unit.target: If no Logo is specified, the application’s small logo is used.

trans-unit.source: Info Tip
trans-unit.target: Info Tip

trans-unit.source: Specify the [info tip](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144152) for a group of file types.
trans-unit.target: Specify the [info tip](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/cc144152) for a group of file types.

trans-unit.source: This tool tip text appears when the user hovers on the icon for a file of this type.
trans-unit.target: This tool tip text appears when the user hovers on the icon for a file of this type.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Choose a name for a group of file types that share the same display name, logo, info tip, and edit flags.
trans-unit.target: Choose a name for a group of file types that share the same display name, logo, info tip, and edit flags.

trans-unit.source: Choose a group name that can stay the same across app updates.
trans-unit.target: Choose a group name that can stay the same across app updates.

trans-unit.source: **Note** The Name must be in all lower case letters.
trans-unit.target: **Note** The Name must be in all lower case letters.

trans-unit.source: Content Type
trans-unit.target: Content Type

trans-unit.source: Specify the MIME content type, such as **image/jpeg**, for a particular file type.
trans-unit.target: Specify the MIME content type, such as **image/jpeg**, for a particular file type.

trans-unit.source: **Important Note about allowed content types: **Here is an alphabetic list of MIME content types that you cannot enter into the package manifest because they are either reserved or forbidden: **application/force-download**, **application/octet-stream**, **application/unknown**, **application/x-msdownload**.
trans-unit.target: **Important Note about allowed content types: **Here is an alphabetic list of MIME content types that you cannot enter into the package manifest because they are either reserved or forbidden: **application/force-download**, **application/octet-stream**, **application/unknown**, **application/x-msdownload**.

trans-unit.source: File type
trans-unit.target: File type

trans-unit.source: Specify the file type to register for, preceded by a period, for example, “.jpeg”."
trans-unit.target: Specify the file type to register for, preceded by a period, for example, “.jpeg”."

trans-unit.source: **Reserved and forbidden file types** See [Reserved URI scheme names and file types](reserved-uri-scheme-names.md) for an alphabetic list of files types for built-in apps that you can't register for your UWP apps because they are either reserved or forbidden.
trans-unit.target: **Reserved and forbidden file types** See [Reserved URI scheme names and file types](reserved-uri-scheme-names.md) for an alphabetic list of files types for built-in apps that you can't register for your UWP apps because they are either reserved or forbidden.

trans-unit.source: Enter `alsdk` as the **Name**.
trans-unit.target: Enter `alsdk` as the **Name**.

trans-unit.source: Enter `.alsdk` as the **File Type**.
trans-unit.target: Enter `.alsdk` as the **File Type**.

trans-unit.source: Enter “images\\Icon.png” as the Logo.
trans-unit.target: Enter “images\\Icon.png” as the Logo.

trans-unit.source: Press Ctrl+S to save the change to package.appxmanifest.
trans-unit.target: Press Ctrl+S to save the change to package.appxmanifest.

trans-unit.source: The steps above add an [**Extension**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211400) element like this one to the package manifest.
trans-unit.target: The steps above add an [**Extension**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br211400) element like this one to the package manifest.

trans-unit.source: The **windows.fileTypeAssociation** category indicates that the app handles files with the `.alsdk` extension.
trans-unit.target: The **windows.fileTypeAssociation** category indicates that the app handles files with the `.alsdk` extension.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Add the proper icons
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Add the proper icons

trans-unit.source: Apps that become the default for a file type have their icons displayed in various places throughout the system.
trans-unit.target: Apps that become the default for a file type have their icons displayed in various places throughout the system.

trans-unit.source: For example these icons are shown in:
trans-unit.target: For example these icons are shown in:

trans-unit.source: Windows Explorer ItemsView, context menus, and the Ribbon
trans-unit.target: Windows Explorer ItemsView, context menus, and the Ribbon

trans-unit.source: Default programs Control Panel
trans-unit.target: Default programs Control Panel

trans-unit.source: File picker
trans-unit.target: File picker

trans-unit.source: Search results on the Start screen
trans-unit.target: Search results on the Start screen

trans-unit.source: Match the look of the app tile logo and use your app's background color rather than making the icon transparent.
trans-unit.target: Match the look of the app tile logo and use your app's background color rather than making the icon transparent.

trans-unit.source: Have the logo extend to the edge without padding it.
trans-unit.target: Have the logo extend to the edge without padding it.

trans-unit.source: Test your icons on white backgrounds.
trans-unit.target: Test your icons on white backgrounds.

trans-unit.source: For example icons, see the [Association launching sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=620490).
trans-unit.target: For example icons, see the [Association launching sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=620490).

trans-unit.source: the solution explorer with a view of the files in the images folder.
trans-unit.target: the solution explorer with a view of the files in the images folder.

trans-unit.source: there are 16, 32, 48, and 256 pixel versions of both ‘icon.targetsize’ and ‘smalltile-sdk’
trans-unit.target: there are 16, 32, 48, and 256 pixel versions of both ‘icon.targetsize’ and ‘smalltile-sdk’

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Handle the activated event
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Handle the activated event

trans-unit.source: The [**OnFileActivated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242331) event handler receives all file activation events.
trans-unit.target: The [**OnFileActivated**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242331) event handler receives all file activation events.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that apps create a new XAML Frame for each activation event that opens a new page.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that apps create a new XAML Frame for each activation event that opens a new page.

trans-unit.source: This way, the navigation backstack for the new XAML Frame will not contain any previous content that the app might have on the current window when suspended.
trans-unit.target: This way, the navigation backstack for the new XAML Frame will not contain any previous content that the app might have on the current window when suspended.

trans-unit.source: Apps that decide to use a single XAML Frame for Launch and File Contracts should clear the pages on the Frame's navigation journal before navigating to a new page.
trans-unit.target: Apps that decide to use a single XAML Frame for Launch and File Contracts should clear the pages on the Frame's navigation journal before navigating to a new page.

trans-unit.source: When launched via File activation, apps should consider including UI that allows the user to go back to the top page of the app.
trans-unit.target: When launched via File activation, apps should consider including UI that allows the user to go back to the top page of the app.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The files that you receive could come from an untrusted source.
trans-unit.target: The files that you receive could come from an untrusted source.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you validate the content of a file before taking action on it.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you validate the content of a file before taking action on it.

trans-unit.source: For more info on input validation, see [Writing Secure Code](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=142053)
trans-unit.target: For more info on input validation, see [Writing Secure Code](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=142053)

trans-unit.source: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: **Note** This article is for Windows 10 developers writing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
trans-unit.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the [archived documentation](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132).
